title: How To Do Amazon Keyword Research Using Helium 10 | FULL TUTORIAL 2026!

tactics.name: Cerebro Keyword Analysis
tactics.description: Use Helium 10's Cerebro tool to analyze top-selling products' keywords by filtering organic listings and applying search volume/competitor filters.
steps: Select top 10 organic products using X-ray (exclude sponsored)
Apply filters: min search volume (200-400), min 3 competitors, top 20 organic rank
caveats: Filters may reduce keyword volume but improve quality
source_quotes: 'we only care about products ranked well organically'

tactics.name: filter_by_indexed_products
tactics.description: Filter keywords by ensuring at least three products/sellers are indexed in top 20 organic results for relevance
steps: Apply filter to reduce keyword list from 200+ to 38
Manually review remaining terms for relevance
Exclude terms like 'silicon chopping board' if product doesn't match
caveats: Too strict filters may leave fewer than 10 terms
source_quotes: ast three of these products or at least three of these sellers are indexed...

tactics.name: Cerebro + Magnet Keyword Filtering
tactics.description: Combine Cerebro's reverse ASIN analysis with Magnet's database to capture high-volume keywords while filtering noise.
steps: Use Cerebro for reverse ASIN analysis
Run Magnet with Helium 10's keyword database
Set minimum word count filter (2+ words)
Manually vet remaining keywords for relevance
caveats: Magnet returns more irrelevant keywords requiring manual filtering
source_quotes: 'Magnet returns a lot more keywords and many of them aren't as relevant'

heuristics.name: Competitor Filter Heuristic
heuristics.condition: If keywords are used by at least 3 competitors in top 20 rank, prioritize them
source_quotes: 'we want at least three of these products to have included this search term'

heuristics.name: sort_by_search_volume
heuristics.condition: If keywords remain after filtering, prioritize those with highest search volume
source_quotes: sort them by search volume with the highest at the top

heuristics.name: Volume-Filtered Keyword Boost
heuristics.condition: If search volume exceeds 300, prioritize keyword
source_quotes: 'bump the search volume to 300 to get rid of more noise'

claims.statement: Cerebro's reverse acing technique is used in paid courses and mentorship programs
source_quotes: 'this is the exact method I teach in my course'

claims.statement: Cerebro allows exporting up to 150 keywords to a folder for later reference
source_quotes: scroll down to the very bottom... change this up to 150

claims.statement: Helium 10's Magnet tool generates broader keyword lists but requires manual filtering to remove irrelevant terms.
source_quotes: 'Magnet instead of doing a reverse acing... pulls from Helium 10's own database'

niche_patterns.example: chopping board + kitchen use + durable material
niche_patterns.description: Target specific buyer needs with product attributes
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Filters out irrelevant keywords by focusing on organic top sellers
source_quotes: 'we want to find the search terms that are most relevant'

niche_patterns.example: chopping board + cutting surface + commercial use
niche_patterns.description: Identify product-specific keywords with functional constraints for better targeting
niche_patterns.why_it_works: Filters out generic terms like 'kitchen' while retaining actionable keywords
source_quotes: 'vape guard or vape board, tighter, chef, commercial, kitchen'
